message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The developmental milestones of a healthy 4-month-old include smiling at their mother. Reaching out for objects is expected at 6 months, responding to their name at 7-9 months, and crying when separated from their mother at 8-9 months.

Reaching out for objects and responding to their name are expected at 6-9 months, while crying when separated from their mother may occur at multiple stages.

Reaching out for objects is expected at around 3-4 months of age, responding to her own name at around 7-9 months, and crying when separated from her mother at around 8-9 months.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's developmental age is around 2-3 months old. Smiling at mother is a social skill that typically appears at this age, while reaching out for objects, responding to name, and separation anxiety typically appear at a later age (4-6 months). The ability to lift chest and shoulders, follow objects with eyes, and exhibit a stepping motion are also appropriate for this age. The Babinski reflex, which causes the big toe to curl upward and the other toes to fan out when the sole of the foot is stroked, is also normal at this age.
